body: Correct this if it's wrong but Scripture or Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless (the body is to be resurrected and perfected), hence transgender people who try to change their gender here are kind of in conflict with not only their temporal (or earthly) identity but even their eternal identity that exists without end
body_html: Correct this if it's wrong but Scripture or Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless (the body is to be resurrected and perfected), hence transgender people who try to change their gender here are kind of in conflict with not only their temporal (or earthly) identity but even their eternal identity that exists without end
title: Showerthought: Transgenders Will Be The Gender They Were Born With Forever In Heaven Or Hell

body:
I always thought of heaven and hell as C. S. Lewis did: a state of mind. Would advice to read "The Great Divorce".

In this book, people from hell can freely visit heaven. But there is a catch. They have to give up a vice or two. All other than one, fail and return to hell eventually. There is no punishment there anyway, and quite "rational" people live in there and have guilds as well (social events and what not).

The idea is that heaven in theory is for the sinless. No lust, no pride, no sin. There are people there (in the book) who confront their murderer full with forgiveness, but the murderers themselves have a harder time to forgive themselves.

So if a transgender or not, will get himself or herself in a state of mind that prohibits him or her to go to heaven, they will stay in hell. The catch is that they have to accept heaven and the hard work that comes with that.

Just my thoughts.

The idea is that heaven in theory is for the sinless. No lust, no pride, no sin. There are people there (in the book) who confront their murderer full with forgiveness, but the murderers themselves have a harder time to forgive themselves.

So if a transgender or not, will get himself or herself in a state of mind that prohibits him or her to go to heaven, they will stay in hell. The catch is that they have to accept heaven and the hard work that comes with that.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
>“Then those people are right who say that Heaven and Hell are only states of mind?”

>“Hush,” said he sternly. “Do not blaspheme. Hell is a state of mind—ye never said a truer word. And every state of mind, left to itself, every shutting up of the creature within the dungeon of its own mind—is, in the end, Hell. But Heaven is not a state of mind. Heaven is reality itself. All that is fully real is Heavenly. For all that can be shaken will be shaken and only the unshakeable remains.”
body_html:
“Then those people are right who say that Heaven and Hell are only states of mind?”

“Hush,” said he sternly. “Do not blaspheme. Hell is a state of mind—ye never said a truer word. And every state of mind, left to itself, every shutting up of the creature within the dungeon of its own mind—is, in the end, Hell. But Heaven is not a state of mind. Heaven is reality itself. All that is fully real is Heavenly. For all that can be shaken will be shaken and only the unshakeable remains.”

body:
> Scripture doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

"The children of this age marry and give in marriage, but those considered worthy to obtain the next age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry or give in marriage, nor can they die anymore, as they are like angels. And they are children of God being children of the resurrection." - Luke 20:34-36

> Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

If you ignore everything early, that is.

Plus, your logic says that people born with horrible diseases and disabilities will have them forever, and if they fix or treat them on earth they will still revert back for eternity.
body_html:
Scripture doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

"The children of this age marry and give in marriage, but those considered worthy to obtain the next age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry or give in marriage, nor can they die anymore, as they are like angels. And they are children of God being children of the resurrection." - Luke 20:34-36

Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

If you ignore everything early, that is.

Plus, your logic says that people born with horrible diseases and disabilities will have them forever, and if they fix or treat them on earth they will still revert back for eternity.

body: [The Catholic view of hell](https://www.newadvent.org/cathen/07207a.htm) is a place of suffering from being separated from God and from fire in a literal or metaphorical sense

body:
Why do you think Jesus thought it should be obvious that marriage ends in the next age? Because we will be *like angels*, and there are not male and female angels, therefore they do not marry, nor will we. And without sex what is the point of gender?

> the diseased and disabled bodies are restored to perfection in the afterlife (at least in heaven)

But were they not born that way? By the logic of your OP, isn't that how they're supposed to be?
body_html:
Why do you think Jesus thought it should be obvious that marriage ends in the next age? Because we will be like angels, and there are not male and female angels, therefore they do not marry, nor will we. And without sex what is the point of gender?

the diseased and disabled bodies are restored to perfection in the afterlife (at least in heaven)

But were they not born that way? By the logic of your OP, isn't that how they're supposed to be?

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

post.body: Correct this if it's wrong but Scripture or Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless (the body is to be resurrected and perfected), hence transgender people who try to change their gender here are kind of in conflict with not only their temporal (or earthly) identity but even their eternal identity that exists without end

body:
It really is an interesting question. I always learned that people would be genderless spirits in Heaven. Matthew 22:30 says (in response to marriage in the resurrection) that we will be as angels, so all unions of that nature will be invalidated.

From what I've read of Catholic exorcism tradition (which doesn't seem to be subject to the Magisterium at all, so you know, take it as you will) they say that the Fallen don't have bodies at all, they simply manifest in physical places in accordance with "cracks" or entry points. If that's correct, then I imagine gender isn't an issue (but I doubt trannies are getting into Heaven in the first place tbh.)

I haven't actually read much Aquinas, but he's the big angel guy, right? Maybe you can crack that metaphor by reading him XD unfortunately he's low on my reading list, so I have to live with the mystery.
body_html:
It really is an interesting question. I always learned that people would be genderless spirits in Heaven. Matthew 22:30 says (in response to marriage in the resurrection) that we will be as angels, so all unions of that nature will be invalidated.

From what I've read of Catholic exorcism tradition (which doesn't seem to be subject to the Magisterium at all, so you know, take it as you will) they say that the Fallen don't have bodies at all, they simply manifest in physical places in accordance with "cracks" or entry points. If that's correct, then I imagine gender isn't an issue (but I doubt trannies are getting into Heaven in the first place tbh.)

I haven't actually read much Aquinas, but he's the big angel guy, right? Maybe you can crack that metaphor by reading him XD unfortunately he's low on my reading list, so I have to live with the mystery.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
> Matthew 22:30

Although marriage will be no more in heaven, it doesn't seem to indicate that gender will not be either (Scripture appears to be silent on the topic, although if the body is literally resurrected then, without major modifications, our bodies would still be gendered)

Demons seem to take many forms

body:
If there is no sex or marriage then why would there be gender?

If we remain gendered, then why did Jesus expect the end of marriage to be obvious since we will "be like angels"?
